2-3A-1: SHORT TITLE:
This article shall be known and may be cited as the CITY OF GLENPOOL SALES TAX
ORDINANCE. (2002 Code § 3.08.010)
2-3A-2: DEFINITIONS:
   A.   Definitions Generally: The definitions of words, terms and phrases
contained in the Oklahoma sales tax code, 68 Oklahoma Statutes article 13, as
amended, are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this article.
   B.   Tax Collector Defined: The term "tax collector", as used in this
article, means the finance department of the city or the official agency of the
state duly designated according to law or contract authorized by law and to
administer the collection of the tax levied by this article. (Ord. 457, 1-2-
2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3A-3: SALES TAXES IMPOSED; RATES; EFFECTIVE DATES; PURPOSES:
The following city sales taxes in the total amount of five and one-tenth
percent (5.1%) are and/or shall be imposed and effective as indicated, unless
otherwise extended, amended or repealed by a vote of the people. Said taxes
have been approved by a majority of the registered voters of the city voting on
same in elections conducted in the manner prescribed by 11 Oklahoma Statutes
section 16-112, and any amendments thereto, or its predecessor as applicable.
Ordinance 40 became effective on February 18, 1972, levying a sales tax of two
percent (2.0%), and shall remain in effect thereafter until such time as this
tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of the city at an election held for
such purpose. The purpose of said two percent (2.0%) tax is to provide revenues
for the support of the functions of the municipal government of the city of
Glenpool, incorporated as the city of Glenpool by resolution 5779, adopted by
the city board on May 7, 1979.
Ordinance 176 became effective on October 1, 1972, levying a sales tax of one
percent (1.0%), and shall remain in effect thereafter until such time as this
tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of the city at an election held for
such purpose. The purpose of said one percent (1.0%) tax is to provide revenues
for the purpose of placing such revenues in the sinking fund of the city to be
used to pay the principal and interest requirements on general obligation bonds
of the city, with the surplus of such one percent (1.0%) sales tax, after
satisfaction of such sinking fund requirements, to be retained in the general
fund of the city to be used for any lawful purpose.
The foregoing ordinances 40 and 176 established the previously codified three
percent (3.0%) sales tax upon all taxable sales, for the combined purpose of
providing revenues for the support of the functions of the municipal government
of the city. (2002 Code §§ 3.08.060, 3.08.070)
Ordinance 457 became effective April 1, 2001, levying an additional sales tax
of one percent (1.0%) for a period of twenty (20) years from April 1, 2001 to
and including March 31, 2021. The purpose of the one percent (1.0%) tax is to
provide revenue for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, equipping,
operating and/or maintaining capital improvements and/or to be applied or
pledged toward the payment of principal and interest on any legal indebtedness,
including refunding indebtedness, incurred by or on behalf of the city for such
purposes; provided, however, that after making provision in any calendar year
for payment of all principal and interest required to be paid during such
calendar year on any legal indebtedness, including refunding indebtedness, so
incurred by or on behalf of the city for such purposes the balance of the net
revenues derived from the tax levied shall be used for acquiring, constructing,
equipping, operating and/or maintaining any capital improvements by or on
behalf of the city and/or be applied or pledged toward the payment of principal
and interest on any legal indebtedness, including refunding indebtedness,
incurred by or on behalf of the city for such purposes. (2002 Code §§ 3.08.060,
3.08.070; amd. Ord. 457, 1-2-2001; 2013 Code)
Ordinance 717 became effective July 1, 2016, levying an additional sales tax of
fifty five hundredths of one percent (0.55%) and shall remain in effect
thereafter until such time as this tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of
the city at an election held for such purpose. The purpose of the fifty five
hundredths of one percent (0.55%) tax is to provide revenues to be placed in a
separate, special fund to be used to fund the staffing of additional police and
firefighting personnel of the city. Such revenues shall supplement, not
supplant, existing and future budgetary appropriations from the city's general
fund for police and fire operations. (Ord. 717, 3-7-2016)
Ordinance 715 became effective January 1, 2017, levying an additional sales tax
of twenty nine hundredths of one percent (0.29%) and shall remain in effect
thereafter until such time as this tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of
the city at an election held for such purpose or upon the expiration of twenty
(20) years from the effective date of January 1, 2017 to and including December
31, 2036, whichever occurs sooner. The purpose of the twenty nine hundredths of
one percent (0.29%) tax is to provide revenues to be placed in a separate,
special fund to be used to fund capital improvements pertaining to road and
street improvements, water and wastewater system improvements, storm sewer
improvements, acquisition of parks maintenance equipment, improvements to
public park lands and facilities, and promoting economic development all within
said city, and/or to be applied or pledged toward the payment of principal and
interest on any indebtedness, including refunding indebtedness, incurred by or
on behalf of said city for such purposes, including payment of the costs of
issuance of such indebtedness. (Ord. 715, 2-1-2016)
Ordinance 716 became effective January 1, 2017, levying an additional sales tax
of twenty six hundredths of one percent (0.26%) and shall remain in effect
thereafter until such time as this tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of
the city at an election held for such purpose or upon the expiration of twenty
(20) years from the effective date of January 1, 2017 to and including December
31, 2036, whichever occurs sooner. The purpose of the twenty six hundredths of
one percent (0.26%) tax is to provide revenues to be placed in a separate,
special fund to be used to fund capital improvements pertaining to police and
fire equipment and vehicles, system improvements to police and fire
communications equipment and infrastructure, and police and fire facilities
within said city, and/or to be applied or pledged toward the payment of
principal and interest on any indebtedness, including refunding indebtedness,
incurred by or on behalf of said city for such purpose, including payment of
the costs of issuance of such indebtedness. Such revenues shall supplement, not
supplant, existing and future budgetary appropriations from the city's general
fund for police and fire operations. (Ord. 716, 2-1-2016)
Ordinance 776 became effective April 1, 2021, levying an additional sales tax
of one percent (1.00%) and shall remain in effect thereafter until such time as
the tax is repealed by a vote of the electors of the City at an election held
for such purpose or upon the expiration of twenty (20) years from the effective
date of April 1, 2021, whichever occurs sooner; provided that, if the proceeds
of any sales tax hereby levied are being used by the City of Glenpool for the
purpose of retiring indebtedness incurred by the City or by a public trust of
which the City is a beneficiary for the specific purpose for which the sales
tax was imposed, the sales tax shall not be repealed until such time as the
indebtedness is retired. The purpose of this tax is to provide revenue for the
purposes of acquiring, constructing, equipping, operating and/or maintaining
capital improvements and/or to be applied or pledged toward the payment of
principal and interest on any legal indebtedness, including refunding
indebtedness, incurred by or on behalf of the City for such purposes. (Ord.
776, 6-1-2020)
2-3A-4: SUBSISTING STATE PERMITS:
All valid and subsisting permits to do business issued by the Oklahoma tax
commission pursuant to the Oklahoma sales tax code are, for the purposes of
this article, hereby ratified, confirmed, and adopted in lieu of any
requirement for an additional city permit for the same purpose. (Ord. 457, 1-2-
2001)
2-3A-5: CLASSIFICATION OF TAXPAYERS:
For the purpose of this article, the classification of taxpayers hereunder
shall be as prescribed by state law for purposes of the Oklahoma sales tax
code. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-6: SALES SUBJECT TO TAX; EXEMPTIONS:
The city sales taxes shall be levied upon the gross receipts or gross proceeds
of such sales as specified by Oklahoma Statutes, and exemptions from such taxes
shall be allowed pursuant to Oklahoma Statutes. (2013 Code)
2-3A-7: TAX DUE DATE:
The tax levied hereunder shall be due and payable at the time and in the manner
and form prescribed for payment of the state sales tax under the Oklahoma sales
tax code. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-8: PAYMENT OF TAX; BRACKETS:
   A.   The tax herein levied shall be paid to the tax collector at the time
and in form and manner provided for payment of state sales tax under the
Oklahoma sales tax code.
   B.   The bracket system for the collection of the city sales tax by the tax
collector shall be the same as hereafter adopted by the agreement of the city
and the tax collector, in the collection of both the city sales tax and the
state sales tax. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3A-9: COLLECTION BY VENDORS:
   A.   The tax levied hereunder shall be paid by the consumer or user to the
vendor, and it shall be the duty of each and every vendor in the city to
collect from the consumer or user the full amount of the tax levied by this
article, or an amount equal as nearly as possible or practicable to the average
equivalent thereof.
   B.   Vendors shall add the tax imposed hereunder, or the average equivalent
thereof, to the sales price or charge, and when added, such tax shall
constitute a part of such price or charge, shall be a debt from the consumer or
user to the vendor until paid, and shall be recoverable at law in the same
manner as other debts. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
   C.   A "vendor", as defined herein, who wilfully or intentionally fails,
neglects or refuses to collect the full amount of the tax levied by this
article, or wilfully or intentionally fails, neglects or refuses to comply with
the provisions hereof or remits or rebates to a consumer or user, either
directly or indirectly, and by whatsoever means, all or any part of the tax
herein levied, or makes in any form of advertising, verbally or otherwise, any
statement which infers that he is absorbing the tax, or paying the tax for the
consumer or user by an adjustment of prices or at a price including the tax, or
in any manner whatsoever, shall, upon conviction, be deemed guilty of an
offense punishable as provided in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 201 et seq.,
section
1-4-1 of this code and as set forth in the municipal bond schedule adopted by
the governing body as provided in section
1-11-19 of this code. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3A-10: RETURNS, REMITTANCES AND DISCOUNTS:
Returns and remittances of the tax herein levied and collected shall be made to
the tax collector at the time and in the manner, form and amount as prescribed
for returns and remittances required by the Oklahoma sales tax code; and
remittances of tax collected hereunder shall be subject to the same discount as
may be allowed by the Oklahoma sales tax code for collection of state sales
tax. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-11: DELINQUENCIES; INTEREST AND PENALTIES:
   A.   Failure To Pay Tax: 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 217, as amended, and
section 1350 et seq., as amended, are hereby adopted by reference and made a
part of this article, and interest and penalties at the rates and in the
amounts as therein specified are hereby levied and shall be applicable in cases
of delinquency in reporting and paying the tax levied by this article.
Provided, that the failure or refusal of any taxpayer to make and transmit the
reports and remittances of tax in the time and manner required by this article
shall cause such tax to be delinquent. In addition, if the delinquency
continues for a period of five (5) days, the taxpayer shall forfeit his claim
to any discount allowed under this article.
   B.   Waiver: The interest or penalty or any portion thereof accruing by
reason of a taxpayer's failure to pay the city sales tax herein levied may be
waived or remitted in the same manner as provided for the waiver or remittance
as applied in administration of the state sales tax provided in 68 Oklahoma
Statutes section 220, as amended; and to accomplish the purposes of this
subsection, the applicable provisions of said section 220 are hereby adopted by
reference and made a part of this article. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-12: FRAUDULENT RETURNS:
In addition to all civil penalties provided by this article, any taxpayer who
wilfully fails or refuses to make reports and remittances herein required, or
makes any false and fraudulent report for the purpose of avoiding or escaping
payment of any tax or portion thereof rightfully due under this article shall,
upon conviction thereof, be deemed guilty of an offense punishable as provided
in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 201 et seq., section
1-4-1 of this code and as set forth in the municipal bond schedule adopted by
the governing body as provided in section
1-11-19 of this code. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3A-13: ENFORCEMENT OF PAYMENT:
Such taxes, penalty and interest due hereunder shall at all times constitute a
prior, superior and paramount claim as against the claims of unsecured
creditors, and may be collected by suit as any other debt. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-14: REFUND OF ERRONEOUS PAYMENTS:
Refund of erroneous payment of the city sales tax herein levied may be made to
any taxpayer making such erroneous payment in the same manner and procedure and
under the same limitations of time as provided for administration of the state
sales tax as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 227, as amended, and to
accomplish the purpose of this section, the applicable provisions of said 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 227 are hereby adopted by reference and made a part
of this article. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
2-3A-15: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records and files concerning the
administration of the city sales tax is legislatively recognized and declared,
and to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 205, as
amended, of the Oklahoma sales tax code, and each subsection thereof, are
hereby adopted by reference and made fully effective and applicable to
administration of the city sales tax as if herein set forth in full. (Ord. 457,
1-2-2001)
2-3A-16: AMENDMENTS:
The people of the city, by their approval of the sales tax ordinances from
which this article was derived, hereby authorize the city council, by
ordinances duly enacted, to make such administrative and technical changes or
additions in the method and manner of administering and enforcing this article
as may be necessary or proper for efficiency and fairness; except, that neither
the rate of the tax herein provided, nor the term, nor the purpose of the tax
herein provided shall be changed without approval of the qualified electors of
the city as provided by law. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3A-17: PROVISIONS CUMULATIVE:
The provisions of this article shall be cumulative and in addition to any and
all taxing provisions of this code or city ordinances. (Ord. 457, 1-2-2001)
ARTICLE B. USE TAX
SECTION:
2-3B-1: Short Title

2-3B-1: SHORT TITLE:
This article shall be known and may be cited as the CITY OF GLENPOOL USE TAX
ORDINANCE. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-2: DEFINITIONS:
The definitions of words, terms and phrases contained in the Oklahoma use tax
code, 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1401, are hereby adopted by reference and
made a part of this article. In addition thereto, the following words and terms
shall have the following meanings:
CITY: The city of Glenpool, Oklahoma.
TAX COLLECTOR: The finance department of the city or the official agency of the
state duly designated according to law or contract authorized by law to
administer the collection of the tax herein levied.
TRANSACTION: Sale. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3B-3: USE TAXES IMPOSED; SUBJECTS OF TAXATION; RATES; EFFECTIVE DATES;
PURPOSES:
There is hereby levied and there shall be paid by every person storing, using
or otherwise consuming within the boundaries of the city of Glenpool tangible
personal property that is purchased outside the state of Oklahoma (that is, not
taxed by another in-state jurisdiction) and stored, used or otherwise consumed
within the boundaries of the city, an excise tax on such storage, use or other
consumption within the city of such property at the aggregate rate of five and
one-tenth percent (5.1%) of the purchase price of such property. The use tax
levied hereunder shall be paid at the time of importation or storage of such
property within the city and shall be assessed to only property that is
purchased outside Oklahoma; provided, that the tax levied hereunder shall not
be levied against tangible personal property intended solely for use outside
the city, but which is stored in the city pending shipment outside the city or
which is temporarily retained in the city for the purpose of fabrication,
repair, testing, alteration, maintenance, or other service. Any person liable
for payment of the use tax authorized herein may deduct from such tax any local
or municipal sales tax previously paid on such goods or services; provided,
that the amount deducted shall not exceed the amount that would have been due
if the taxes imposed by the city had been levied on the sale of such goods or
services. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. Ord. 726, 12-13-2016; Ord.
727, 12-13-2016)
Ordinance 465 became effective April 17, 2001, levying a use tax in the total
amount of four percent (4.0%) that corresponds to the sales taxes levied by
ordinances 40, 176, and 457, as identified in section
2-3A-3 of this chapter and shall be and remain in effect thereafter until such
time as ordinances 40, 176, and 457 levying and assessing the equivalent sales
tax shall be repealed by a vote of the electors of the city at an election held
for such purpose or otherwise expire in accordance with the provisions of the
respective sales tax ordinances. The use tax levied and assessed under this
ordinance shall be used to provide revenues for the support of the functions of
the municipal government of the city of Glenpool, and any and all revenues
derived hereunder may be expended by the governing body of the city for any
purpose for which funds may be lawfully expended. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-
17-2001)
The fifty five hundredths of one percent (0.55%) use tax levied by ordinance
721, took effect on July 1, 2016, being the same date that the fifty five
hundredths of one percent (0.55%) sales tax levied in accordance with city of
Glenpool ordinance 717 went into effect and being the first day of a calendar
quarter, and shall be and remain in effect thereafter until such time as
ordinance 717, levying and assessing the equivalent sales tax, is repealed by a
vote of the electors of the city at an election held for such purpose. Pursuant
to 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 2701, the use tax levied and assessed under
this ordinance shall be used by the city of Glenpool for such general and
special purposes of municipal government as the Oklahoma legislature may levy
and collect for purposes of state government, subject to any applicable
statutory limitations or exemptions. (Ord. 721, 5-16-2016)
The twenty nine hundredths of one percent (0.29%) use tax levied by ordinance
727, took effect on January 1, 2017, being the same date that the twenty nine
hundredths of one percent (0.29%) sales tax levied in accordance with city of
Glenpool ordinance 715 went into effect and being the first day of a calendar
quarter, and shall be and remain in effect thereafter until such time as
ordinance 715, levying and assessing the equivalent sales tax, is repealed by a
vote of the electors of the city at an election held for such purpose or upon
the expiration of twenty (20) years from the effective date of January 1, 2017
to and including December 31, 2036, whichever occurs sooner. Pursuant to 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 2701, the use tax levied and assessed under this
ordinance shall be used by the city of Glenpool for such general and special
purposes of municipal government as the Oklahoma legislature may levy and
collect for purposes of state government, subject to any applicable statutory
limitations or exemptions. (Ord. 727, 12-13-2016)
The twenty six hundredths of one percent (0.26%) use tax levied by ordinance
726, took effect on January 1, 2017, being the same date that the twenty six
hundredths of one percent (0.26%) sales tax levied in accordance with city of
Glenpool ordinance 716 went into effect and being the first day of a calendar
quarter, and shall be and remain in effect thereafter until such time as
ordinance 716, levying and assessing the equivalent sales tax, is repealed by a
vote of the electors of the city at an election held for such purpose or upon
the expiration of twenty (20) years from the effective date of January 1, 2017
to and including December 31, 2036, whichever occurs sooner. Pursuant to 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 2701, the use tax levied and assessed under this
ordinance shall be used by the city of Glenpool for such general and special
purposes of municipal government as the Oklahoma legislature may levy and
collect for purposes of state government, subject to any applicable statutory
limitations or exemptions. (Ord. 726, 12-13-2016)
2-3B-4: EXEMPTIONS FROM TAX:
The provisions of this article shall not apply:
   A.   In respect to the use of an article of tangible personal property
brought into the city by a nonresident individual visiting in the city for his
or her personal use or enjoyment while within the city;
   B.   In respect to the use of tangible personal property purchased for
resale before being used;
   C.   In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property on
which a tax equal to or in excess of that levied by both the Oklahoma use tax
code and this article has been paid by the person using such tangible personal
property in the city, whether such tax was levied under the laws of Oklahoma or
some other state or municipality of the United States. If any article of
tangible personal property has already been subjected to a tax by Oklahoma or
any other state or municipality in respect to its sale or use, in an amount
less than the tax imposed by both the Oklahoma use tax code and this article,
the provisions of this article shall also apply thereto by a rate measured by
the difference only between the rate provided by both the Oklahoma use tax code
and this article, and the rate by which the previous tax upon the sale or use
was computed. Provided, that no credit shall be given for taxes paid in another
state or municipality if that state or municipality does not grant like credit
for taxes paid in Oklahoma and the city;
   D.   In respect to the use of tangible personal property now specifically
exempted from taxation under article A of this chapter;
   E.   In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property
brought into the city by an individual with intent to become a resident of the
city where such personal property is for such individual's personal use or
enjoyment;
   F.   In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property used
or to be used by commercial airlines or railroads;
   G.   In respect to livestock purchased outside Oklahoma and brought into the
city for feeding or breeding purposes, and which are later resold. (Ord. 465,
4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3B-5: PURPOSES OF REVENUES:
It is hereby declared to be the purpose of this article to provide revenues for
the support of the functions of the city, and any and all revenues derived
hereunder may be expended by the city council for any purpose for which funds
may be lawfully expended as authorized. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-6: SUBSISTING STATE PERMITS:
All valid and subsisting permits to do business issued by the tax commission
pursuant to the Oklahoma use tax code are, for the purpose of this article,
hereby ratified, confirmed and adopted in lieu of any requirement for an
additional city permit for the same purpose. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-
2001)
2-3B-7: CLASSIFICATION OF TAXPAYERS:
For the purpose of this article, the classification of taxpayers hereunder
shall be prescribed by state law. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd.
2013 Code)
2-3B-8: TAX DUE DATE:
The tax levied by this article is due and payable at the time and in the manner
and form prescribed for payment of the state use tax under the Oklahoma use tax
code. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-9: COLLECTION OF TAX:
   A.   Places Of Business Both Within And Without State: Except as provided in
68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1376, providing an exemption for certain printing
activities, every retailer or vendor maintaining places of business both within
and without the state of Oklahoma, and making sales of tangible personal
property from a place of business outside this state for use in the city shall,
at the time of making such sales, collect the use tax levied by this article
from the purchaser and give to the purchaser a receipt therefor in the manner
and form prescribed by the tax commission, if the tax commission shall, by
regulation, require such receipt. Each retailer or vendor shall list with the
tax commission the names and addresses of all his agents operating in the city
and location of any and all distribution or sales houses or offices or other
places of business in the city. The retailer or vendor shall not collect the
use tax levied by section
2-3B-3 of this article from a purchaser who is a holder of a direct payment
permit issued pursuant to 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1364.1. (Ord. 465, 4-17-
2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
   B.   Place Of Business Not Within State Or Both Within And Without State:
The tax commission may, in its discretion, upon application, authorize the
collection of the tax herein levied by any retailer or vendor not maintaining a
place of business within this state but who makes sales of tangible personal
property for use in the city and by the out of state place of business of any
retailer or vendor maintaining places of business both within and without
Oklahoma and making sales of tangible personal property at such out of state
place of business for use in the city. Such retailer or vendor may be issued,
without charge, a permit to collect such taxes by the tax commission in such
manner and subject to such regulations and agreements as it shall prescribe.
When so authorized, it shall be the duty of such retailer or vendor to collect
the tax upon all tangible personal property sold to his knowledge for use
within the city. Such authority and permit may be canceled when, at any time,
the tax commission considers that such tax can more effectively be collected
from the person using such property in the city. Provided, however, that in all
instances where such sales are made or completed by delivery to the purchaser
within the city by the retailer or vendor in such retailer's or vendor's
vehicle, whether owned or leased (not by common carrier), such sales or
transactions shall continue to be subject to applicable municipal sales tax at
the point of delivery, and the tax shall be collected and reported under the
taxpayer's sales tax permit number accordingly. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-
17-2001)
2-3B-10: REVOKING PERMITS:
Whenever any retailer or vendor not maintaining a place of business in this
state, or both within and without this state, and authorized to collect the tax
herein levied, fails to comply with any of the provisions of this article or
the Oklahoma use tax code or any orders, rules or regulations of the tax
commission, the tax commission may, upon notice and hearing as provided in 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 1408, by order, revoke the use tax permit, if any,
issued to such retailer or vendor, and if any such retailer or vendor is a
corporation authorized to do business in this state may, after notice and
hearing above provided, cancel said corporation's license to do business in
this state and shall issue a new license only when such corporation has
complied with the obligations under this article, the Oklahoma use tax code, or
any orders, rules or regulations of the tax commission. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001,
eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-11: REMUNERATIVE DEDUCTIONS:
Returns and remittances of the tax herein levied and collected shall be made to
the tax commission at the time and in the manner, form and amount as prescribed
for returns and remittances required by the Oklahoma use tax code, and
remittances of the tax collected hereunder shall be subject to the same
discount as may be allowed by said code for the collection of state use taxes.
(Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-12: DELINQUENCIES; INTEREST AND PENALTIES:
   A.   Failure To Pay Tax: 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 217 is hereby adopted
and made a part of this article, and interest and penalties at the rates and in
the amounts as therein specified are hereby levied and shall be applicable in
cases of delinquency in reporting and paying the tax levied by this article.
Provided, that the failure or refusal of any retailer or vendor to make and
transmit the reports and remittances of tax in the time and manner required by
this article shall cause such tax to be delinquent. In addition, if such
delinquency continues for a period of five (5) days, the retailer or vendor
shall forfeit his claim to any discount allowed under this article. (Ord. 465,
4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
   B.   Waiver Of Interest And Penalties: The interest or penalty, or any
portion thereof, accruing by reason of a retailer's or vendor's failure to pay
the municipal tax herein levied may be waived or remitted in the same manner as
provided for said waiver or remittance as applied in the administration of the
state use tax provided in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 220, and to accomplish
the purposes of this subsection, the applicable provisions of said section 220
are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this article. (Ord. 465, 4-
17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3B-13: FRAUDULENT RETURNS:
In addition to all civil penalties provided by this article, any taxpayer who
wilfully fails or refuses to make reports and remittances herein required, or
makes any false and fraudulent report for the purpose of avoiding or escaping
payment of any tax or portion thereof rightfully due under this article, shall,
upon conviction thereof, be deemed guilty of an offense punishable as provided
in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 201 et seq., section
1-4-1 of this code and as set forth in the municipal bond schedule adopted by
the governing body as provided in section
1-11-19 of this code. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3B-14: ENFORCEMENT OF PAYMENT:
Such taxes, penalty and interest due hereunder shall at all times constitute a
prior, superior and paramount claim as against the claims of unsecured
creditors, and may be collected by suit as any other debt. (Ord. 465, 4-17-
2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-15: REFUND OF ERRONEOUS PAYMENTS:
Refund of erroneous payment of the municipal use tax herein levied may be made
to any taxpayer making such erroneous payment in the same manner and procedure
and under the same limitations of time as provided for the administration of
the state use tax as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 227, and to
accomplish the purpose of this section, the applicable provisions of said
section 227 are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this article.
(Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
2-3B-16: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records and files concerning the
administration of the municipal use tax is legislatively recognized and
declared, and to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes
section 205, and each subsection thereof, is hereby adopted by reference and
made fully effective and applicable to the administration of the municipal use
tax as is herein set forth in full. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001; amd.
2013 Code)
2-3B-17: PROVISIONS CUMULATIVE:
The provisions hereof shall be cumulative and in addition to any and all other
taxing provisions of the city. (Ord. 465, 4-17-2001, eff. 4-17-2001)
ARTICLE C. HOTEL OCCUPANCY TAX
SECTION:
2-3C-1: Definitions
2-3C-2: Tax Levied; Rate
2-3C-3: Exemptions From Tax
2-3C-4: Operator Duties
2-3C-5: Bond Requirements
2-3C-6: Assessment And Determination Of Tax
2-3C-7: Delinquent Payment Penalty
2-3C-8: Refunds
2-3C-9: Notices
2-3C-10: Remedies Exclusive
2-3C-11: Powers Of City Council
2-3C-12: Certificates
2-3C-13: Use Of Funds; Discounts
2-3C-14: Records Confidential
2-3C-15: Criminal Penalties
2-3C-16: Civil Remedies
2-3C-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this article, the following words and terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this section:
HOTEL: Any building or buildings, structures, trailer, or other facility in
which the public may, for consideration, obtain sleeping accommodations, and in
which five (5) or more rooms are used for the accommodation of such occupant,
whether such rooms are in one or several structures. The term shall include
hotels, apartmental hotels, motels, tourist courts, lodging houses, inns,
rooming houses, and apartments not occupied by "permanent residents", as said
term is defined in this section. The term shall not include hospitals,
sanatoriums or nursing homes.
OCCUPANCY: The use or possession, or the right to the use or possession, of any
room or rooms in a hotel, or the right to the use or possession of the
furnishings or the services and accommodations accompanying the use and
possession of the room or rooms.
OCCUPANT: The person who, for a consideration, uses, possesses, or has the
right to the use or possession, of any room or rooms in a hotel under any
lease, concession, permit, right of access, license to use, or other agreement.
OPERATOR: Any person operating a hotel within the city, including, but not
limited to, the owner, proprietor, manager, lessee, sublessee, mortgagee in
possession, licensee, or any other person otherwise operating such hotel.
PERMANENT RESIDENT: Any occupant who has or shall have the right of occupancy
of any room or rooms in a hotel and/or motel for at least thirty (30)
consecutive days during the current calendar year or preceding year.
PLACE OF ASSEMBLY: A room or space which is occupied by persons and which is
used for educational or amusement purposes and shall include: dance halls;
cabarets; nightclubs; restaurants; any room or space for public or private
banquets, feasts, socials, card parties or weddings; lodge and meeting halls or
rooms; skating rinks; gymnasiums; swimming pools; billiard, bowling and table
tennis rooms; halls; rooms used for public or private catering purposes;
funeral parlors; markets; recreational rooms; concert halls; broadcasting
studios; and all other places of similar use and occupancy.
RENT: The consideration received for occupancy valued in money, whether
received in money or otherwise, including all receipts, cash credits, and
property or services of any kind or nature, and also any amount for which
credit is allowed by the operator to the occupant, without any deduction
therefrom whatsoever.
RETURN: Any report filed or required to be filed as herein provided.
ROOM: Any room or suite of rooms of any kind in any part or portion of a hotel
which is available for or let out for use or possessed for any purpose other
than as a "place of assembly", as defined in this section.
TAX: The tax levied pursuant to this article. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-2: TAX LEVIED; RATE:
There is hereby levied an excise tax of five percent (5%) upon the gross
proceeds or gross receipts derived from all rent for every occupancy of a room
or rooms in a hotel in the city; except, that the tax shall not be imposed
where the rent is less than the rate of five dollars ($5.00) per day. The tax
rate shall become effective September 15, 2007. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-3: EXEMPTIONS FROM TAX:
   A.   Entities Exempt: The following shall be exempt from the tax levied in
this article:
      1.   Permanent residents.
      2.   The United States government or any agency or division thereof.
      3.   The state of Oklahoma or any political subdivision thereof.
      4.   As prescribed by the Oklahoma tax commission.
   B.   Certificate Of Exemption Required: Anyone otherwise claiming to be
exempt from the tax must present to the lodging facility a certificate of
exemption. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-4: OPERATOR DUTIES:
   A.   Designate Tax On Bills: The operator shall separately designate, charge
and show the tax on all bills, statements, receipts or any other evidence of
charge or payment of rent for occupancy issued or delivered by the operator. In
the absence of a certificate of exemption as specified in section
2-3C-3 of this article, it shall be presumed that the rent on all occupancies
is taxable, and the burden of proof shall be on the operator.
   B.   Collect Tax: The operator shall be responsible for the collection of
the tax from the occupant and shall be liable to the city for the tax which
shall be held in trust by the operator until paid to the city. The operator
shall join the city as a party to any action brought by the operator to enforce
collection of the tax.
   C.   Records Kept: Every operator shall keep records of every occupancy and
of all rent paid, charged, or due thereon and of the tax payable thereon in
such form as the city manager or his designee may, by regulation, require. Such
records shall be available for inspection and examination at any time upon
demand by the city manager, or his designee, or a duly authorized agent or
employee of the city and shall be preserved for a period of three (3) years.
   D.   Returns:
      1.   Every operator shall file with the city manager or his designee a
report of occupancy and of rents, and of the taxes payable thereon for the
period ending on the last day of each month following the effective date
hereof. Such return shall be filed within the first twenty (20) days after the
end of each such month.
      2.   Each operator shall further file with the city manager or his
designee, monthly, a copy of his completed Oklahoma state sales tax form.
      3.   The form of return shall be prescribed by the city manager or his
designee and shall contain such information as may be deemed necessary for the
proper administration of this article. The city manager or his designee may
require amended returns to be filed within twenty (20) days after notice and to
contain the information specified in the notice.
   E.   Payment Of Tax: At the time of filing a return of occupancy and of
rents, each operator shall pay to the city treasurer the taxes imposed by this
article upon the rents included in such return. All taxes not paid with a
timely return shall be delinquent. All the taxes for the period for which a
return is required to be filed shall be due from the operator and payable to
the city treasurer on or before the date fixed for the filing of the return for
such period without regard to whether a return is filed or whether the return
which is filed correctly shows the amount of rents and the taxes due thereon.
   F.   Interest: If any tax levied by this article becomes delinquent, the
person responsible and liable for such tax shall pay interest on such unpaid
tax at the rate of one and one-half percent (11/2%) per month on the unpaid
balance from the date of delinquency. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-5: BOND REQUIREMENTS:
Where the city manager or his designee believes that any operator is about to
cease business, leave the state, or remove or dissipate assets, or for any
other similar reason the city manager or his designee deems it necessary in
order to protect revenues under this article, the city manager or his designee
may require such operator to file with the city a bond issued by a surety
company authorized to transact business in the state in such amount as the city
manager or his designee may fix to secure the payment of any tax or penalties
and interest due, or which may become due, from such operator. In the event
that the city manager or his designee determines that an operator is to file
such bond, the city manager or his designee shall give notice to such operator
specifying the amount of security required. The operator shall file such
security as a performance bond or irrevocable letter of credit within five (5)
days after the filing of such notice unless, within such five (5) days, the
operator shall request in writing a hearing before the city council, at which
time, the necessary proprietary and amount of the bond shall be determined by
the city council. Such determination shall be final, and there shall be
compliance within fifteen (15) days thereafter. In lieu of such bond, a cash or
securities escrow, in an amount and under terms approved by the city manager or
his designee, may be deposited with the city manager or his designee who may,
at any time after five (5) days' notice to the depositor, apply them to any tax
and/or any penalties due, and for that purpose, the securities may be sold at
private or public sale. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-6: ASSESSMENT AND DETERMINATION OF TAX:
   A.   If a return required by this article is not filed, or if a return when
filed is incorrect or insufficient, the amount of tax due shall be assessed by
the city manager or his designee from such information as may be obtainable,
and if necessary, the tax may be estimated on the basis of external indices,
such as number of rooms, location, scale of rents, comparable rents, types of
accommodations and services, number of employees, or other factors. Written
notice of such assessments shall be given to the person liable for the
collection and payment of the tax. Such assessment shall finally and
irrevocably fix and determine the tax:
      1.   Unless the person against whom it is assessed shall apply in writing
to the city council within ninety (90) days after the city gives notice of such
assessment for a hearing; or
      2.   Unless the city manager or his designee decides to reassess the
same.
   B.   After such hearing, the city council shall give written notice of its
determination to the person against whom the tax is assessed, and such
determination shall be final. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-7: DELINQUENT PAYMENT PENALTY:
A five percent (5%) penalty shall be assessed for the payment of delinquent
taxes. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-8: REFUNDS:
   A.   Procedure: The city manager or his designee shall direct the refund or
credit of any tax erroneously, illegally or unconstitutionally collected if
written application to the city manager or his designee for such refund is made
within two (2) years from the date of payment thereof. For like causes, and in
the same period, a refund may be so made upon the initiative of the city
manager or his designee subject to existing limits on the authority of the city
manager or his designee as to amount. The city manager or his designee, in lieu
of any refund required to be made, may allow credit thereof on payments due
from the applicant. Whenever a refund is made, the reasons therefor shall be
stated in writing. Such application may be made by the person who has collected
and paid such tax to the city treasurer; however, no refund of money shall be
made to the operator until the operator has repaid to the occupant the amount
for which the application for refund is made.
   B.   Determination And Hearing: Upon application for a refund, the city
manager or his designee may receive evidence with respect thereto and make such
investigation as is deemed necessary. After making a determination as to the
refund, the city manager or his designee shall give written notice thereof to
the applicant. Such determination shall be final unless the applicant, within
ninety (90) days after such notice, shall apply in writing to the city council
for a hearing. After such hearing, the city council shall give written notice
of its decision to the applicant. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-9: NOTICES:
Notices provided under this article shall be deemed to have been given when
such notice has been delivered personally to the operator or deposited in the
United States mail, postage prepaid, to the last known address of the operator.
In the absence of written evidence received by the city to the contrary, the
last known address shall be presumed to be the address shown on the certificate
of registration as required by section
2-3C-12 of this article. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-10: REMEDIES EXCLUSIVE:
The remedies provided in this article shall be the exclusive remedies available
to any person for the review of tax liability imposed by this article. (Ord.
581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-11: POWERS OF CITY COUNCIL:
In addition to all other powers granted to the city council, the council,
through its representative, is hereby authorized:
   A.   To make, adopt and amend rules and regulations appropriate to the
execution of this article and for the purposes hereof and to designate its
representative.
   B.   To extend, for cause shown, the time for filing any return for a period
not exceeding sixty (60) days; and for cause shown, to waive, remit, or reduce
penalties or interest.
   C.   To delegate functions hereunder to authorized designees for the city.
   D.   To prescribe methods for determining the taxable and nontaxable rents.
   E.   To administer oaths and take affidavits concerning any matter or
proceeding under this article.
   F.   To subpoena and require the attendance of witnesses and the production
of books, papers and documents to secure information pertinent to the
performance and the enforcement of this article and to examine them in relation
thereto. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-12: CERTIFICATES:
   A.   Filing Certificate Of Registration: Every operator shall file with the
city manager or his designee a certificate of registration in a form prescribed
by the city manager or his designee within ten (10) days after the effective
date hereof, or in the case of operators commencing business or opening new
hotels after such effective date, within three (3) days after such commencement
or opening.
   B.   Issuance Of Certificate Of Authority: The city manager or his designee
shall, within five (5) days after such registration, issue, without charge, to
each operator a certificate of authority empowering such operator to collect
the tax from the occupant and duplicates thereof for each additional hotel.
Each certificate or duplicate shall state the hotel to which it is applicable.
   C.   Display Of Certificate Of Authority: The certificate of authority shall
be permanently displayed by the operator in such manner that it may be seen and
will come to the notice of all occupants and persons seeking occupancy.
   D.   Nontransferability Of Certificates: The certificates shall be
nonassignable and nontransferable and shall be surrendered immediately to the
city manager or his designee upon the cessation of business at the hotel named
or upon its sale or transfer. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-13: USE OF FUNDS; DISCOUNTS:
   A.   All taxes collected pursuant to this article shall be set aside and
used exclusively to encourage, promote and foster economic development. As a
part of economic development, the funds may also be used to promote and foster
leisure, culture and tourism in the city and the cost of enforcing this
article.
   B.   The city is authorized to retain from the initial proceeds of the hotel
tax an amount equal to the costs of the election concerning this article and
borne by the city.
   C.   In order to remunerate an operator for keeping tax records, filing
reports, and remitting the tax when due, a discount, not to exceed one percent
(1%) of the current taxes due, may be allowed to the operator by agreement.
(Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
2-3C-14: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records file concerning the
administration of the hotel tax is legislatively recognized and declared, and
in order to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes section
205, and each subsection thereof and all amendments thereto, are hereby adopted
by reference and made fully effective and applicable to the administration of
this article as if herein set forth. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3C-15: CRIMINAL PENALTIES:
   A.   Any taxpayer who wilfully fails or refuses to make reports and
remittances herein required or makes any false and fraudulent report for the
purpose of avoiding or escaping payment of any tax or portion thereof
rightfully due under this article shall, upon conviction thereof, be deemed
guilty of an offense punishable as provided in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 201
et seq., section
1-4-1 of this code and as set forth in the municipal bond schedule adopted by
the governing body as provided in section
1-11-19 of this code.
   B.   Any operator who fails: 1) to file a security bond as required; or 2)
to register or to display the certificate of registration; or 3) to separately
state the tax on the bill or to collect such tax from the occupant shall, upon
conviction thereof, be deemed guilty of an offense punishable as provided in 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 201 et seq., section
1-4-1 of this code and as set forth in the municipal bond schedule adopted by
the governing body as provided in section
1-11-19 of this code. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007; amd. 2013 Code)
2-3C-16: CIVIL REMEDIES:
   A.   Whenever any operator, occupant or other person shall fail to collect
and/or pay over any tax, or to owe any tax, penalty or interest imposed by this
article as herein provided, the mayor may authorize the director of finance to
file notice of liens on behalf of the city against the real estate upon which
the hotel is located and/or against all franchises, property and rights to
property, whether real or personal, then belonging to or thereafter acquired by
the person owing the tax pursuant to 68 Oklahoma Statutes sections 2701 and
2704.
   B.   The liens shall, upon proper filing, attach to the real estate and/or
personal property then owned or thereafter acquired by the debtor, whether such
property is used by the debtor in the operation of business or is under the
authority of an assignee, trustee, or receiver for the benefit of creditors,
from the date such taxes are due and payable as allowed by 68 Oklahoma Statutes
section 2704.
   C.   The city manager or his designee shall notify the person owing the tax
by personal service or by certified mail that the city will file such liens if
any delinquent lodging taxes, interest and/or penalties are not paid within
fifteen (15) days of receiving such notice.
   D.   The city council may also authorize the city attorney to institute an
action in person and in rem to enforce payment and collect any delinquent
lodging taxes, penalties and/or interest. (Ord. 581, 9-4-2007)
CHAPTER 4
COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FEE SCHEDULE
SECTION:
2-4-1: Fee Schedule Adopted
2-4-1: FEE SCHEDULE ADOPTED:
Charges for the following inspection, utility hookup, license, application and
permit fees, along with a list of potential fines for development activities
undertaken without any applicable inspection, utility hookup, license, approved
application or permit required by any of title 10 (building and development),
title 11 (zoning), title 12 (subdivisions) of this code or by any other
applicable code or lawful requirement, as the same may be from time to time
adopted, amended, deleted or replaced, are expressly incorporated herein by
reference and shall be maintained on file in the offices of the city community
development department. The following list is meant to be suggestive only. The
requirements for development in the city and the corresponding charges, fees
and penalties, as may from time to time be amended by the city council, shall
be maintained in the community development department and shall be relied upon
as comprehensive. (Ord. 644, 2-7-2011; amd. 2013 Code)
   A.   One- and two-family residential new construction building permit and
related fees:
      1.   Building permit fee.
      2.   Zoning clearance.
      3.   Plan review.
      4.   Field inspection.
      5.   Water and wastewater impact.
      6.   Water tap.
      7.   Sewer tap.
      8.   Water service deposit.
      9.   Parks and recreation development.
      10.   State building permit.
   B.   Mobile/manufactured home installation building permit and related fees:
      1.   Building permit fee.
      2.   Zoning clearance.
      3.   Field inspection.
      4.   Water and wastewater impact.
      5.   Water tap.
      6.   Sewer tap.
      7.   Water service deposit.
      8.   Parks and recreation development.
      9.   State building permit.
   C.   Related residential building permits, fees and fines:
      1.   Remodeling:
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Zoning clearance.
         c.   Plan check.
         d.   Field inspection.
         e.   State building permit.
      2.   Garage (detached):
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Zoning clearance.
         c.   Plan check.
         d.   Field inspections.
         e.   State building permit.
      3.   Accessory building:
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Zoning clearance.
         c.   Plan check.
         d.   Field inspections.
         e.   State building permit.
      4.   Patio covers or awnings (attached):
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Zoning clearance.
         c.   Plan check.
         d.   Field inspections.
         e.   State building permit.
      5.   Swimming pools (inground):
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Zoning clearance.
         c.   Plan check.
         d.   Field inspections.
         e.   State building permit.
      6.   Reroofing:
         a.   Building permit fee.
         b.   Field inspections.
         c.   State building permit.
      7.   Generally applicable:
         a.   Work started without a building permit (fine).
         b.   Miscellaneous field inspections.
         c.   Reinspection.
         d.   Missed inspection (fine).
   D.   Multi-family new construction building permit and related fees:
      1.   Building permit fee.
      2.   Zoning clearance.
      3.   Plan review.
      4.   Field inspections.
      5.   Water and wastewater impact.
      6.   Water tap.
      7.   Sewer tap.
      8.   Water service deposit.
      9.   Parks and recreation development.
      10.   State building permit.
   E.   Commercial and office new construction building permit and related
fees:
      1.   Building permit fee.
      2.   Zoning clearance.
      3.   Plan review.
      4.   Field inspections.
      5.   Water tap.
      6.   Sewer tap.
      7.   Water service deposit.
      8.   Park and recreation development.
      9.   Public infrastructure impact.
      10.   State building permit.
   F.   Commercial and office remodeling building permit and related fees:
      1.   Building permit fee.
      2.   Zoning clearance.
      3.   Plan review.
      4.   Field inspections.

      1.   On premises ground mounted (up to 100 square feet).
      2.   On premises ground mounted (greater than 100 square feet).

      4.   Outdoor advertising billboard.
      5.   On premises banner.
      6.   Building wall mounted.

      10.   Temporary on site banner or portable sign (14 day).
      11.   Temporary on site banner or portable sign (30 day).
      12.   Permanent on site banner (office, commercial, industrial).
      13.   Temporary off site residential subdivision banner (30 day).
      14.   Temporary off site residential (30 day): directional, real estate,
or open house.
      15.   Residential garage sale.
      16.   Election: local, state, national.
      17.   Removing or rehanging existing sign.
      18.   Unified sign plan review and permit.
      19.   Illegally placed or nonpermitted sign (fine).
   N.   Miscellaneous sign related fees and fines:
      1.   Removing or rehanging existing sign.

   O.   Engineering fees:

TITLE 3
BUSINESS AND LICENSE REGULATIONS
CHAPTER 1
GENERAL BUSINESS AND LICENSE REGULATIONS
SECTION:
3-1-1: License Fees Required For Certain Businesses
3-1-2: Payment Of License Fee; Issuance Of License; Expiration
3-1-3: Separate Licenses Required
3-1-4: Duplicate Licenses
3-1-5: Nontransferability Of License
3-1-6: Display Of License
3-1-7: Commercial Activity On Private Property
3-1-8: Revocation Of License
3-1-1: LICENSE FEES REQUIRED FOR CERTAIN BUSINESSES:
A license fee, as established by the city council, is required for every
person, firm, association, or corporation engaging in, exercising, or pursuing
any of the following businesses, professions, trades, occupations or privileges
in the city:
   A.   Itinerant shows, exhibitions, or entertainments (comedy, musical,
dramatic, or other) which charge admission; provided, that this shall not apply
to circuses, street fairs and carnivals, nor to shows, etc., given for the
benefit of education, or other nonprofit purposes.
   B.   Circuses.
   C.   Street fairs or carnivals (including all activities under their
auspices).
   D.   Ferris wheels, merry-go-rounds, small cars or similar apparatus, when
not under the auspices of a street fair, carnival, or circus.
   E.   Coin operated music or amusement device as defined by 68 Oklahoma
Statutes section 1501, which may be operated by penny coins.
   F.   For each coin operated vending device, as defined by 68 Oklahoma
Statutes section 1501, other than those which may be operated by penny coins.
(2002 Code § 5.04.010; amd. 2013 Code)
3-1-2: PAYMENT OF LICENSE FEE; ISSUANCE OF LICENSE; EXPIRATION:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person, firm, association, or corporation to
engage in, exercise, or pursue any business, profession, trade, occupation, or
privilege for which a license fee is required by section
3-1-1 of this chapter or by any other ordinance or ordinance provision without
paying the license fee and securing and possessing a valid license therefor.
Upon making proper application to the city clerk, the payment of the license
fee, and fulfillment of any other condition which may be prescribed by law and/
or ordinance, the city clerk shall issue a license therefor.
   B.   Annual licenses shall expire on June 30 of each year. When an annual
license is issued after December 31 for the remainder of the license year, the
license fee shall be one- half (1/2) of the established fee. (2002 Code §
5.04.020; amd. 2013 Code)
3-1-3: SEPARATE LICENSES REQUIRED:
Every person, firm, association, or corporation who engages in, exercises, or
pursues a business, profession, trade, occupation, or privilege for which a
license is required, at or from more than one place in the city, or who engages
in, exercises, or pursues more than one such business, profession, trade,
occupation, or privilege, shall pay the fee and secure a separate license for
each such place and/or for each such profession, trade, occupation or
privilege. (2002 Code § 5.04.030)
3-1-4: DUPLICATE LICENSES:
Whenever any license to engage in, exercise, or pursue a business, profession,
trade, occupation, or privilege has been lost or destroyed without any wrongful
act or connivance by the holder, the city clerk, on application, shall issue a
duplicate license for the unexpired time of the original license. Before the
duplicate is issued, the original holder shall make and file with the city
clerk an affidavit that the license has not been transferred or given to
another person, that it has not been lost, destroyed or stolen through any
wrongful act, knowledge, or connivance by the original holder, and that, if
believed lost, the holder has made diligent search therefor and has not been
able to find it or learn of its whereabouts. The fee for every duplicate
license issued, payable to the city clerk, shall be as established by
resolution of the city council. (2002 Code § 5.04.070; amd. 2013 Code)
3-1-5: NONTRANSFERABILITY OF LICENSE:
The assignment or transfer of licenses is not permitted in the city. (2002 Code
§ 5.04.060; amd. 2013 Code)
3-1-6: DISPLAY OF LICENSE:
Every holder of a license to engage in, exercise, or pursue a business,
profession, trade, occupation, or privilege shall conspicuously display the
license at all times in some part of his or her place of business or activity
where a person who has entered the place may readily see it or, if he or she
has no particular place of business or activity, shall carry the license and
display it to any person who requests to see it. Provided that, in lieu of this
manner of displaying such licenses, when licenses are required for coin
operated music or amusement devices, vending machines, and similar devices and
equipment, the license may be placed on or attached to such device or equipment
in such position and manner that it will be clearly visible, and shall be so
placed or attached if the license so states on its face. It is unlawful to fail
or refuse to display the license as required in this section. (2002 Code §
5.04.040)
3-1-7: COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY ON PRIVATE PROPERTY:
It is unlawful for any person, firm, or corporation, including a civic or
religious organization, to sell, barter, trade or transfer any merchandise,
wearing apparel, or other personal property of any kind on or in any property
in the city without the consent of the owner or person in control of the
property. (2002 Code § 5.40.030; amd. 2013 Code)
3-1-8: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
Any license issued by the city to any person, firm, association, or corporation
to engage in, exercise, or pursue any business, profession, trade, occupation,
or privilege, may be revoked by the city manager or city manager's designee for
the following reasons: a) that the licensee is engaging in, exercising, or
pursuing the business, profession, trade, occupation, or privilege in such a
manner that he or she has created or is creating a public nuisance as defined
by 50 Oklahoma Statutes sections 1 and 2 1 ; or b) serious and repeated
violation of the law or ordinances. Provided that, valid licenses may be
revoked only when the business, profession, trade, occupation, or privilege is
one which the city council has power to prohibit because of its nature or
because of the manner in which it is engaged, exercised, or pursued. (2002 Code
§ 5.04.050; amd. 2013 Code)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 6, chapter 5 of this code.
CHAPTER 2
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES 1
SECTION:
3-2-1: Purpose
3-2-2: Definitions
3-2-3: Expiration And Termination Of City-Issued License; Payment Of Occupation
Tax; Proration; Operation Without ABLE License And Payment Of Occupation Tax
Prohibited

3-2-5: Separated Premises; Passageways
3-2-6: Sales In Containers; Consumption Restrictions
3-2-7: Sale At Retail Stores
3-2-8: Location Restrictions
